intro: Pterolepis balansaei var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leafed pterolepis, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leaf structures. The plant features broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy, providing it with a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow and arranged in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
